clinical_study.brief_title: Triaging and Referring in Adjacent General and Emergency Departments
clinical_study.official_title: Triaging and Referring in Adjacent General and Emergency Departments (the TRIAGE-trial): a Cluster Randomised Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Introduction: Patients who might also go to the general practitioner (GP) frequently consult emergency departments (ED). This leads to additional costs for both government and patient and a high workload for emergency physicians in Flanders. The Belgian government wants to address this problem by improved collaboration between EDs and general practice cooperatives (GPCs).
Intervention: Patients presenting at the ED during out-of-hours (OOH) will be triaged and allocated to the most appropriate service. For this purpose the Manchester Triage System (MTS) which is commonly used in Flemish hospitals, will be extended (eMTS). By doing so a trained nurse will be able to diverge suitable patients towards the GPC.
Methodology: The investigators will conduct a cluster randomised controlled trial in which eligible ED patients will be diverged to the GPC using the eMTS. The investigators will collect data using the iCAREdata database. The investigators will study the use of the eMTS, the effectiveness and effects of triage, work load changes, epidemiology at both departments, patient safety, health insurance (HIS) and patient expenditures. Furthermore, facilitators and barriers will be studied and an incident analysis of problem cases will be performed.
Outcome: The primary outcome is the proportion of patients who enter the ED and are handled by the GP after triage. Secondary outcome measurements are related to safety: referral rate to the ED by the GP, proportion of patients not following the triage advice and file review for selected patients.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Cluster randomised with weekends servings as clusters.

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patients presenting at the ED but being treated by the GPC after referral
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patient flow will be followed for 24 hours after presentation at the ED
primary_outcome.description: The difference between intervention and control period will be calculated. Treatment at the GPC means having a record at the GPC.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between the primary outcome and the patient's presenting complaint expressed as the title of a Manchester Triage System presentation
Association between the primary outcome and the urgency of the patient's presentation as expressed by the Manchester Triage System urgency category,
secondary_outcome.description: There are five categories of which the least two urgent ones (green and blue) are in general suitable for primary care

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between the primary outcome and subjective workload at the ED as juged by the emergency nurse
secondary_outcome.description: This urgency has four ordinal categories: uncontrollable busy, busy but under control, normal, quiet.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between the primary outcome and subjective workload at the GPC.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurement a the start of the GP consultation
secondary_outcome.description: Workload at the GPC is objectively measured as the number of patients in the waiting room at the time of consultation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between the primary outcome and the age of the patient
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Registered at the time of presentation at the ED
secondary_outcome.description: Age will be measured in years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between the primary outcome and the sex of the patient
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Regisetered at the time of presentation at the ED
secondary_outcome.description: Sex is either male or female

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between the primary outcome and the ZIP-code of the patient
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Registered at the time of presentation at the ED
secondary_outcome.description: There are 2825 possible ZIP-codes but only the ten most frequent in the studied population are relevant

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between the primary outcome and the social status of the patient
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Registered at the time of presentation at the ED
secondary_outcome.description: Allmost all belgians are subscribed in the national compulsory health insurance. An national database provides information about the social status to allow correct reimbursment of health care costs. This is a dichotomous variable: higher imbursement because of financial situation: yes or no.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between the primary outcome and the season
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Depends on the time of admission registered at the time of presentation at the ED
secondary_outcome.description: Entire study period of one calendar year will devided in four seasons

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between the primary outcome and the hour of the day of the patient's presentation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Depends on the time of admission registered at the time of presentation at the ED

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation of the primary outcome among the triage nurses,
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patient flow will be followed for 24 hours after presentation at the ED
secondary_outcome.description: All nurses get an anonymized ID. The primary outcome will be measured for all nures individually.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of correct triage decisions: patients compliant to a GPC-advice or non-compliant to an ED-advice.
other_outcome.time_frame: Patient flow will be followed for 24 hours after presentation at the ED
other_outcome.description: This is the number of patients treated at the GPC to number of patients referred back to the ED by the GP.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of correct triage decisions: patients compliant to an ED-advice or non-compliant to a GPC-advice: opinion of the emergency physician.
other_outcome.time_frame: Registred at the time the emergency physicians finishes routine electronical health record
other_outcome.description: The emergency physicians will register their opinion about the ideal location of the patient in the routine electronical health records: ED or GPC.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of correct triage decisions: patients compliant to an ED-advice or non-compliant to a GPC-advice: admissionrate.
other_outcome.time_frame: Registred at the time the emergency physicians finishes routine electronical health record
other_outcome.description: Proportion of the number of patients compliant to an ED-advice or non-compliant to a GPC-advice who get admitted tot the hospital to the total number of these patients. Admission is registered by the nursing staff in the routine electronical health records

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients compliant to a GPC advice who get admitted
other_outcome.time_frame: Patient flow will be followed for 24 hours after presentation at the ED
other_outcome.description: Admission is registered by the nursing staff in the routine electronical health records.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who are not compliant to the triage a GPC advice
other_outcome.time_frame: Patient flow will be followed for 24 hours after presentation at the ED
other_outcome.description: Compliant patients will have a record at the GPC, non-compliant patients will have a consultation report at the ED or will be registred as left without being seen,

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who are not compliant to the triage an ED advice
other_outcome.time_frame: Patient flow will be followed for 24 hours after presentation at the ED
other_outcome.description: Compliant patients will have a record at the ED, non-compliant patients will have a consultation report at the GPC or will be registered as left without being seen,

other_outcome.measure: Porportion of patients left without being seen at the ED
other_outcome.time_frame: Patient flow will be followed for 24 hours after presentation at the ED
other_outcome.description: Proportion of patients registred as left without being seen in the routine electronical health records to the total number of included patients

arm_group.arm_group_label: Triage without referral to primary care

intervention.intervention_name: Triage with referral to primary care
intervention.description: During intervention weekends(and holidays) a nurse will triage patients using a newly developped extended Manchester Triage System (eMTS). Patients appropriate for primary care will be referred to the general practitioner on call.We will inform patients about the nature of the intervention using leaflets and broadcasting in the waiting room of the Emergency Department.
intervention.arm_group_label: Triage with referral to primary care

intervention.description: During a control weekend (and holidays), all data registration and collection will be the same as during intervention weekends but patents will not be informed about their allocation advice. The emergency physician will see all patients deciding to stay at the ED, without influence of the triage advice. As in standard clinical care, patients will have the right to change their mind and go spontaneously to the general practitioner. . During control weekends, we will only inform about triage in general but no about the general practioner or the intervention.
intervention.arm_group_label: Triage without referral to primary care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- availability of a Belgian citizen national insurance number
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients arriving at the ED by an ambulance with a doctor or nurse
- Patients all ready admitted to an other hospital department

patient_data.ipd_description: Even the researchers will only have very limited access to individual data. All collected data will be stored in the "iCAREdata" database (see http://www.icaredata.eu/) and as such will be accessible when necessary.
